metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8960 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in libraries/error_report.lib.php in the error-reporting feature in phpMyAdmin 4.1.x before 4.1.14.7 and 4.2.x before 4.2.12 allows remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted filename.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8960` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.2.12-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.2.12-1').
